title: 109_s2279
content: The Act titled "Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Enforcement Act of 2006" cites sanctions applicable under the Iran Nonproliferation Act of 2000. The Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Act of 2006 amends Section 3 to apply measures for a minimum of 2 years to foreign persons and entities related to them. The Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Act of 2006 amends Executive Order 12938 by adding new investment prohibitions for US persons in property owned or controlled by foreign persons or entities. The Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Act of 2006 prohibits US persons from approving, financing, or guaranteeing transactions involving foreign entities or their subsidiaries. Additionally, the US Government is prohibited from providing financial assistance to these entities. The Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Act of 2006 prohibits US persons from engaging in transactions with foreign entities or their subsidiaries. It also prohibits the US Government from providing financial assistance to these entities. Measures applied under the Act must be announced in the Federal Register, including the names and addresses of those affected. The Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Act of 2006 prohibits transactions with foreign entities. Measures applied must be announced in the Federal Register. National Security Waiver amended under Section 4 of the Act. The Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Act of 2006 prohibits transactions with foreign entities, with measures announced in the Federal Register. The National Security Waiver can be amended under Section 4 of the Act. The President has the authority to waive sanctions under the Iran and Syria Nonproliferation Act of 2006 if deemed essential to national security. The waiver must be reported to the relevant congressional committees with a written justification outlining the reasons for the decision. The waiver authority under subsection (a) allows the President to transfer specific goods, services, or technologies without sanctions. The written justification for the waiver must include details of the transfer and the recipient, submitted in unclassified form with a possible classified annex.
